thread.title: Chelsea O'Donnell: I was kicked out

title: Chelsea O'Donnell: I was kicked out
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Chelsea O'Donnell: I was kicked out In August, Rosie O'Donnell launched a social media campaign to recover her runaway 17-year-old daughter. Now, daughter Chelsea is speaking out with a different take on events. Post to Facebook Chelsea O'Donnell: I was kicked out In August, Rosie O'Donnell launched a social media campaign to recover her runaway 17-year-old daughter. Now, daughter Chelsea is speaking out with a different take on events.  //on.11alive.com/1LhANcW   Chelsea O'Donnell: I was kicked out USA Today Network Andrea Mandell, USA TODAY 7:22 a.m. EDT October 7, 2015 The HBO documentary screening of "A Family is a Family: A Rosie O'Donnell Celebration" at the HBO Theater on January 19, 2010 in New York City. (Photo: Stephen Lovekin) 2 CONNECT 2   
In August, Rosie O'Donnell launched a social media campaign to recover her runaway 17-year-old daughter. Now, daughter Chelsea is speaking out with a different take on events. 
Chelsea was kicked out of the house two weeks before her 18th birthday, she says. 
"Rosie knew I was planning to leave, that's why I think she kicked me out," Chelsea, now 18, tells the DailyMail in a new interview. "She asked me to talk about what was going on and I didn't want to. So she asked for my phone and my computer. This was hours before she told me to leave." 
Chelsea continues: "I gave them to her. A few hours later, she told me to leave. I wasn't planning to go until I turned 18 on the 24th. Rosie said that I was almost 18, and she got all this crap from work, and she didn't want to have to deal with that at home too." 
On August 18, O'Donnell posted a frantic notice on her social media accounts, describing what Chelsea was wearing when she was last seen, her tattoo and her black and brown terrier, Bear, a therapy dog who was with her. "Chelsea stopped taking her medicine and is in need of medical attention. Any information please contact authorities," O'Donnell wrote, and listed a police number. Lawyer: Surprise facts will clear man harboring Chelsea O'Donnell 
The description bothered Chelsea. "People think I'm this crazy person and as I've said, I have depression and bad anxiety – but it's been something that's gotten a lot better," says Chelsea. "But these were personal things and I didn't want anyone to know them about me." 
Chelsea also told the Daily Mail was "pretty much raised by nannies" and claims her famous mother is short-fused and "not genuine a lot of the time." — Rosie (@Rosie) September 25, 2015 
Rosie O'Donnell, an ardent tweeter, has yet to comment on the interview on any social platform and her publicist, Cindi Berger, could not confirm the veracity of Chelsea's interview. Berger called the situation with Chelsea "heartbreaking on every level." 
Chelsea was ultimately recovered by police at a the home of her 25-year-old boyfriend Steven Sheerer, who lives with his parents, in Barnegat, N.J. Sheerer was later arrested on the charges of child endangerment and sending Chelsea obscene images. Sheerer's attorney told the media their relationship was consensual, and that the two met on Tinder where Chelsea identified herself as 19. The charges were later dropped. 
There was no happy reunion waiting for her at home, says Chelsea. chelsea has been found and is safe in police custody - thank u all for the help and light #missingchildren — Rosie (@Rosie) August 18, 2015 
Her mother "had two of my bags packed with clothes. Literally 10 minutes after the police had dropped me off at the house, I got in a car and went to a friend's house," says Chelsea. "I was there for a week and then on my 18th birthday my birth mom (Deanna Micolley) picked me up and I went to her home in Wisconsin." 
Chelsea says she is currently living with Sheerer and his family. "I'm really happy to be here, and happier than I've been in years," she says. 
Chelsea Belle O'Donnell is one of three kids Rosie has with ex-wife Kelli Carpenter. Chelsea is adopted but one of the three, Vivienne Rose, was born to Carpenter through artificial insemination. O'Donnell adopted her eldest child, Parker, in 1995 when he was an infant. 
O'Donnell and her second wife, Michelle Rounds, whom she married in December 2011, adopted a baby girl, Dakota, in January 2013. She and Rounds are now in the middle of a contentious divorce. 
PHOTOS | Rosie O'Donnell through the years LAS VEGAS - JUNE 08: Comedian Rosie O'Donnell performs during the kickoff of the first annual True Colors Tour at the MGM Grand Garden Arena June 8, 2007 in Las Vegas, Nevada. Proceeds from the show will benefit equal rights organizations. (Photo by Ethan Miller/Getty Images) Ethan Miller, Getty Images NEW YORK - DECEMBER 2: Comedian Rosie O'Donnell and talk show host Barbara Walters attend the Hetrick-Martin Institutes 2004 Emery Awards at Capitale December 2, 2003 in New York City. (Photo by Paul Hawthorne/Getty Images) Paul Hawthorne, Getty Images Fullscreen NEW YORK - JANUARY 6: (U.S. TABS AND HOLLYWOOD REPORTER OUT) TV personality Rosie O'Donnell (R) and wife Kelli O'Donnell arrive at the opening night of the new musical "Under The Bridge" at The Zipper Theatre, January 6, 2005 in New York City. (Photo by Evan Agostini/Getty Images) Evan Agostini, Getty Images Fullscreen NEW YORK - JANUARY 6: (U.S. TABS AND HOLLYWOOD REPORTER OUT) TV personality Rosie O'Donnell (centre) poses with Kathie Lee Gifford and son Cody as they arrive at the opening night of her new musical "Under The Bridge" on January 6, 2005 at The Zipper Theatre in New York City. (Photo by Evan Agostini/Getty Images) Evan Agostini, Getty Images Fullscreen NEW YORK - MAY 9: Comedian Rosie O'Donnell performs during The 4th Annual Stand-up for Madeline and OCRF, a tribute to Madeline Kahn to benefit the Ovarian Cancer Research Fund at Carolines May 9, 2005 in New York City. (Photo by Paul Hawthorne/Getty Images) Paul Hawthorne, Getty Images NEW YORK - SEPTEMBER 20: Actress Rosie O'Donnell speaks with reporters after her opening night performance of "Fiddler on the Roof" at Minskoff Theater on September 20, 2005 in New York City. (Photo by Andrew H. Walker/Getty Images) Andrew H. Walker, Getty Images Fullscreen NEW YORK - SEPTEMBER 25: Actress/comedian Rosie O'Donnell and her son Parker arrive to the 19th Annual Broadway Flea Market & Grand Auction For Broadway Cares on the patio of Bolzano's Bar Cucina September 25, 2005 in New York City. (Photo by Fernando Leon/Getty Images) Fernando Leon, Getty Images <> the HBO documentary screening of "A Family is a Family: A Rosie O'Donnell Celebration" at the HBO Theater on January 19, 2010 in New York City. Stephen Lovekin attends the 5th Annual Athena Film Festival Ceremony & Reception at Barnard College on February 7, 2015 in New York City. Mike Coppola SiriusXM's "It's Not Over" Town Hall - Rosie O'Donnell interviews author Michelangelo Signorile at SiriusXM Studio on April 2, 2015 in New York City. Monica Schipper Fullscreen NEW YORK, NY - MAY 08: Producer Tina Grapenthin, director Katie Green, documentary subjects Ginger Williams-Cook, Leticia Guimares-Lyle, Jordyn Levine, comedian Rosie O'Donnell and director Carlye Rubin attend the "Dead Mothers Club"premiere at HBO Theater on May 8, 2014 in New York City.
